College of Engineering Alumni have access to attend select UIC-sponsored career fairs and events, unless otherwise noted on the event description. College of Engineering Alumni can also utilize the resources found on this website 24 hours a day.  UIC College of Business Alumni should connect with the Business Career Center to learn about resources available to graduates from the College of Business.  UIC Liberal Arts and Sciences Alumni should connect with UIC's Career Services Office to learn about services available to graduates from the College of Liberal Arts and Sciences.  The School of Public Health has dedicated career services advisors and develops events for alumni.  Engineering Alumni and still have questions? Services Available to Engineering Alumni       Service/Resource  Link  Alumni Access Level      UIC Engineering Career Center Appointments   Schedule an Appointment   College of Engineering Alumni may schedule advising appointments up to 3 years after graduation.     UIC Engineering Career Fairs   Engineering Career Fair   Alumni have access to attend select UIC-sponsored career fairs, unless otherwise noted in the event description.    UICcareers.com (UIC's job board)   UICcareers.com   Lifetime access to UICCareers.com is provided. Click the "Get Access to UICcareers.com" button if you need help setting up or re-activating your UICcareers.com account.    Apply to Mentor Current UIC Engineering Students   Professional Connections Program   College of Engineering Alumni may apply to mentor current UIC Engineering students. Alumni must adhere to UIC's guidelines regarding mentor relationships.    Join UIC Engineering Alumni   Engineering Alumni   Learn about ways to stay engaged with UIC such as volunteering, mentoring, and donating to the College of Engineering.          Additional Resources for Alumni     Network with Other UIC Alumni         Network    UIC Alumni Website  Join our UIC Engineering Alumni Group on LinkedIn         Professional Career Coaching and Counseling Resources         counseling    National Career Development Association’s career counselor directory – Identify one-on-one professional career advising assistance in your area.  UIC Office of Applied Psychological Services (OAPS)* – Obtain professional assistance with stress, anxiety or depression.  Fees are on a sliding scale.   *This mental health clinic is part of the Psychology Department at UIC. OAPS serves the UIC community, including faculty, staff, and students, as well as those living or working in the greater Chicago area. OAPS offers therapy for adults, children, families, and couples – helping individuals make changes that will improve their relationships and personal functioning, and enhance their ability to deal with various life stressors, including career transition.
